intro: Oxydectes subcompressa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed water plantain, is a flowering plant species native to wetland environments in Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Alismataceae and is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that are often submerged or floating. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread across shallow water bodies, forming dense mats. Oxydectes subcompressa plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
